text: -Okay, I'm here,

but if you can't get me
Tom Hanks, I don't know why.

-Because, Brian,
there is another actor

who successfully
made the transition
from comedy to drama.

-Patton Oswald?
-Mm-hmm.

He starred
in the movie "Ratatouille."

Okay, look, I know he's not
who you originally asked for,
but he came here for you,
so why not give it a chance?

-Okay.
-Okay, come on.

Patton Oswald, I'd love for you
to meet Brian Baumgartner.

-Hi.
Thank you for meeting with me.
-It's a pleasure.

My daughter and I are huge fans.
-Oh, thank you.

-I'm sorry, Erica,
but they need you downstairs

for five minutes.
-Okay.
I'll be right back.
-Mr. Baumgartner.
My Lordship.

-That is when I learned
on live TV

that "huckleberry,"
not a funny word.
-[ Chuckles ]
-Oh! Oh, man.

It is such a pleasure
talking with you.

I mean, I don't know exactly
how it's going to help me

become an Oscar-level
dramatic actor,
but this is so much fun.

-So, wait.
You want to become an...
Oscar-level dramatic actor?
-Oh, not want to. I'm going to.
-Brian, when I said I was a fan,

I, um...sort of meant it.
-What?

-I don't think you have it in
you to get where you want to go.

-Well, who are you
to say that to me?

-Look, I know
this isn't easy to hear,

but I mean,
look in the mirror, buddy.
-Me? Yeah.

What exactly have you done
that hasn't sucked?

-Uh, do you want me
to pull up my IMDb page?

-I don't know.
Is your phone small enough?
-What does yours say?

"Smallest role
in the dumbest show ever"?

-Kevin Malone
was a key ingredient,

and "The Office"
was a work of genius!

-Even Toby was funnier
than you!
-You voiced a cartoon rat!

-His name was Remy
and that movie won an Oscar!
-I'm gonna win an Oscar, too,

but I'm actually
gonna be on camera.

-The only Oscar you'll ever get
close to's last name is Mayer,

and it comes in a Wienermobile!
-You piece of --

-What the hell is going on here?
-I'll tell you what's going on!

The next time I ask you
to do something,

either do exactly
what I asked you,
or you're fired.
Your Lordship.
-That's what she said!
It's from his show.
-I never watched it.
